Welcome to your Pock Pock Tutorial, touch the screen to proceed through the tutorial.
Pock Pock is a two player game. So go grab a friend! You can learn how to play Pock Pock together.
Hold the phone between you and your friend, then let your friend grab the top of your phone, but don\'t let go.
Are you both holding the phone comfortably between you? Good! If this feels awkward to you, you can always set the phone on a flat surface and play that way.
All set? Let\'s get started!
Before each play session, you will be given the option to "Pick Your Finger".
Touch the finger you will using to play the game.
Using your selected finger, touch the screen to aim where you want your Pock to go
Release your finger to fire your Pock in the chosen direction
Your goal is to bounce the opponent\'s Pock into one of the two goals on the top or bottom of the screen
Why don\'t you give it a try?
Have you noticed the ring that grows while you are aiming your Pock? That is called your Charge ring
The larger your charge ring, the further your Pock will fly when you release it
Charge the ring too long, and it will shrink, preventing you from getting maximum launch power until you release the pock and try again.
Release the charge at it\'s peak and receive a Charge Bonus for the duration of that launch\'s movement.
While affected by a Charge Bonus, your Pock will launch your opponent further and be launched less.
Why don\'t you give it a try?
Good job scoring! Did you notice? The Pocks will bounce off the goals unless knocked into them by the other Pock.
Good job triggering that charge bonus!
Lookout, however, If both Pocks have a Charge Bonus when they collide, they will cancel each other out and both Pocks will be launched the maximum distance
If you bounce off the score zone, you will begin the process of teleportation.
Bounce a second time to start the teleportation ring, disappearing and reappearing directly where your shaded Pock is positioned
If you appear on top of your Opponents Pock, you will launch them powerfully
Congratulations! You Win! Pock is played until someone scores 5 points.
I\'m sorry, you lostâ€¦ Pock is played until someone scores 5 points.
The game might have ended at 5 points, but feel free to practice as long as you want during the tutorial. When you are ready to quit, simply pause the game.
You can Pause the game at any time by tapping two fingers on either score zone, why don\'t you try it now?
You just paused the game! Your options in the pause menu are 1. return to the title screen, 2. reset the current game, or 3. access the settings.
Tap anywhere above the pause menu to resume the game.
